common_errors.solution: Ensure /proc is mounted: mount -t proc proc /proc

common_errors.cause: Cannot read CPU information (very rare, usually containers)
common_errors.solution: Check /proc permissions. In containers, CPU info may be restricted.
List available columns: lscpu --help. Check spelling.
Check sysfs/procfs available. May indicate kernel issue.

common_errors.error_pattern: Virtualization type could not be determined
common_errors.cause: Cannot detect virtualization (may be bare metal or unsupported hypervisor)
common_errors.solution: Not an error if running on bare metal. Hypervisor may hide info.

common_errors.cause: Unsupported or very new CPU architecture
common_errors.solution: Update util-linux package for newer CPU support.
Mount sysfs: mount -t sysfs sysfs /sys. Required for detailed CPU info.

common_errors.cause: Kernel or CPU doesn't expose topology info
common_errors.solution: Basic info still available. Topology requires kernel support.

common_errors.cause: Some CPUs are offline (power management, hotplug)
common_errors.solution: Not an error - informational. Online CPUs with: echo 1 > /sys/devices/system/cpu/cpuN/online
